flounder.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to not know what to say or do because you feel confused or upset
flounder.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I found myself floundering as I tried to answer her questions.
flounder.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to have a lot of problems and be likely to fail completely
flounder.translation[0].definitions[1].e: More and more firms are floundering because of the recession.
flounder.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to be unable to move easily because you are in deep water or mud, or cannot see very well
flounder.translation[0].definitions[2].e: They were floundering chest-deep in the freezing water.
I could hear them floundering around in the dark.
flounder.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a type of small fish that you can eat
